page.title: 08New Silksworth
page.content: The village of{New Silksworth}dates back to the 1870's when{Lord {Londonderry}began work on sinking a new coal mine. A row of terraced cottages was built for the first workers of the mine. By the mid 1870's {Lord Londonderry}had begun to build a village of mainly single storey terraced cottages to house his miners. The village of{New Silksworth}takes it's name from the colliery and many of the streets of old miners' cottages were named after members of Lord Londonderry's family, such as{Maria {Street}and{Edward Street. After the First World War the village grew larger with new streets round the old ones. Until 1967 it was part of {Durham County}but then it was absorbed by the{Borough of Sunderland.
